comment: Be explicit by listing every available rule. https://github.com/DavidAnson/markdownlint/blob/master/doc/Rules.md
Note that there will be numeric gaps, not every MD number is implemented in markdownlint.
MD001: Header levels should only increment by one level at a time
MD002: First header should be a top level header
MD003: Header style: start with hashes
MD004: Unordered list style
MD005: Consistent indentation for list items at the same level
MD006: Consider starting bulleted lists at the beginning of the line
MD007: Unordered list indentation: 2 spaces
MD009: Disallow trailing spaces

no-trailing-spaces.comment: Empty lines inside list items should not be indented

comment: MD010: No hard tabs, not even in code blocks
MD011: Prevent reversed link syntax
MD012: Disallow multiple consecutive blank lines
MD013: Line length
MD014: Disallow dollar signs used before commands without showing output
MD018: Disallow space after hash on atx style header
MD019: Dissalow multiple spaces after hash on atx style header
MD020: No space inside hashes on closed atx style header
MD021: Disallow multiple spaces inside hashes on closed atx style header
MD022: Headers should be surrounded by blank lines
Some headers have preceeding HTML anchors. Unfortunate that we have to disable this, as it otherwise catches a real problem that trips up some Markdown renderers
MD023: Headers must start at the beginning of the line
MD024: Disallow multiple headers with the same content
MD025: Disallow multiple top level headers in the same document
Gotta have a matching closing brace at the end
MD026: Disallow trailing punctuation in header
Gotta have a semicolon after the ending closing brace
MD027: Dissalow multiple spaces after blockquote symbol
MD028: Blank line inside blockquote
Some 'Why?' and 'Why not?' blocks are separated by a blank line
MD029: Ordered list item prefix
MD030: Spaces after list markers
MD031: Fenced code blocks should be surrounded by blank lines
MD032: Lists should be surrounded by blank lines
Some lists have preceeding HTML anchors. Unfortunate that we have to disable this, as it otherwise catches a real problem that trips up some Markdown renderers
MD033: Disallow inline HTML
HTML is needed for explicit anchors
MD034: No bare URLs used
MD035: Horizontal rule style
MD036: Do not use emphasis instead of a header
MD037: Disallow spaces inside emphasis markers
MD038: Disallow spaces inside code span elements
MD039: Disallow spaces inside link text
MD040: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified
MD041: First line in file should be a top level header
MD042: No empty links
MD043: Required header structure
MD044: Proper names should have the correct capitalization
